tit.cmt: 以下に定義が記されているので、 (meeting place) を取りました。多種の会所名については、XX-kaisho/-gaisho とし、初出のみは、その後ろに XXの英訳＋kaishoを（）で表記しました。例：machi-gaisho (community kaisho)

sen.j: 会所（かいしょ）とは、文字通り解釈すれば、なんらかの会、催し物、寄合・会合が行われるところである。
sen.e: Kaisho (a meeting place for poetry party, viewing-the-moon party, etc.) is a place where a party, entertainments, an assembly or a meeting was held if it is literally interpreted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kaisho literally means a place where a kind of reunion, party, event, assembly or meeting was held.
sen.cmt: なんらかの会、催し物、寄合・会合：a kind of reunion, party, event, assembly or meeting
sen.e: Kaisho literally means a place where a kind of reunion, party, event, assembly or meeting was held.

sen.j: しかし、日本の近世期においては、主として町方において商人組合や地域の公的な集会所・事務所・取引所として用いられた独立した建物が「会所」と名づけられることもあった。
sen.e: In the early-modern times in Japan, however, the term 'kaisho' was sometimes used for independent structures like merchants associations, or public local gathering places, offices and trading places mostly in town.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in Japanese early-modern times the term 'kaisho' was sometimes used for an independent structure like a merchants association, or a public local gathering hall, office and exchange market, mostly in the urban areas.
sen.cmt: 用語、表現を変えました。町方において：文脈からin the urban areasとしました。
sen.e: However, in Japanese early-modern times the term 'kaisho' was sometimes used for an independent structure like a merchants association, or a public local gathering hall, office and exchange market, mostly in the urban areas.

sen.j: 中世期の会所については、会所 (中世)を参照。
sen.e: Refer to kaisho (the medieval period) as for kaisho during the medieval period.
For the details of kaisho in medieval times, see 'kaisho (the medieval times).'
For the details of kaisho in medieval times, see 'kaisho (the medieval times).'

sen.j: 町会内において「町会所」は事務所や集会所として用いられた。
sen.e: machikaisho' was used as an office or a gathering place in machikai.
Machi-gaisho' (community kaisho) of a machigai was used as an office or a gathering place in the community.
sen.cmt: 「町会所」：'machikaisho' →'Machi-gaisho' (community kaisho) *最初の文字が大文字なのは文頭のためです。
sen.e: Machi-gaisho' (community kaisho) of a machigai was used as an office or a gathering place in the community.

sen.j: 町役人が詰めて、町内の住民を集めて奉行所などからの「町触」などの規則を伝達したり、逆に住民が提出する届書を作成する事務を行った。
sen.e: Machiyakunin (municipal officials) stayed in the place in order to assemble people and notify rules such as 'machibure' (laws for merchants and artisans), or contrary to that, he did office work to create application forms for residents to submit.

In kaisho, Machiyakunin (municipal officials) stayed in order to assemble people and notify the regulations issued by the town magistrate office and others, such as 'machibure' (laws for merchants and artisans), or on the contrary, in order to undertake office work such as preparing the application forms for residents.
sen.cmt: 「奉行所などからの」：訳漏れ: issued by the town magistrate office and others
sen.e: In kaisho, Machiyakunin (municipal officials) stayed in order to assemble people and notify the regulations issued by the town magistrate office and others, such as 'machibure' (laws for merchants and artisans), or on the contrary, in order to undertake office work such as preparing the application forms for residents.

sen.j: 都市によってもその仕組みに違いがあり、大坂ではいわゆる「大坂三郷」を構成する各郷ごとに上部機関として「惣会所」が設置されたが、江戸では町名主の役宅が町会所が兼ねた。
sen.e: The systems differed with towns; 'sokaisho' as high institutions were established in each area of 'Osaka sango' (three areas of Osaka) in Osaka, whereas in Edo, official residences of town headmans were used also as machikaisho.
sen.cmt: 大阪三郷を意訳併記しました。
sen.e: The system of kaisho varies from town to town; in Osaka 'so-kaisho' (general kaisho) was set up as a higher institution in each one of the three areas collectively called 'Osaka sango' (three areas of Osaka), on the other hand, in Edo the town headman's official residence was used as 'machi-gaisho.'
sen.cmt: 「大坂三郷」に関する表現を変えました。
sen.e: The system of kaisho varies from town to town; in Osaka 'so-kaisho' (general kaisho) was set up as a higher institution in each one of the three areas collectively called 'Osaka sango' (three areas of Osaka), on the other hand, in Edo the town headman's official residence was used as 'machi-gaisho.'

sen.j: 寛政の改革以後、江戸では七分積金の制度が導入され、積金を管理する場所を「町会所」と呼んだ。
sen.e: After Kansei no kaikaku (the Kansei Reforms), a system of shichibutsumikin (accumulated fund) was introduced, and a place to manage the fund was called 'machikaisho.'

After the Kansei Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in the Kansei era), a system of shichibutsumikin (accumulated fund) was introduced in Edo, and a place to manage the fund was called 'machi-gaisho.'
sen.cmt: 寛政の改革：the Kansei Reforms→the Kansei Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in the Kansei era)「江戸では」：訳漏れ: in Edo
sen.e: After the Kansei Reforms (a series of reforms carried out in the Kansei era), a system of shichibutsumikin (accumulated fund) was introduced in Edo, and a place to manage the fund was called 'machi-gaisho.'

sen.j: 町会所において貧民に対して低利で資金を融資した。
sen.e: Funds were lent to the poor at low interest rates at machikaisho.
At machi-gaisho financing for the poor was offered at low interest rates.
At machi-gaisho financing for the poor was offered at low interest rates.

sen.j: これとは別に江戸猿屋町には札差に対する融資を行う会所が特別に設置された（猿屋町貸金会所）。
sen.e: Apart from this, a special kaisho was established in Saruya-cho town in Edo, where financing for fudasashi (a trader who received or sold kuramai on behalf of the government for commission revenue) was conducted.

On the other hand, a special kaisho was established in Saruya-cho Town in Edo (Saruya-cho Kashikin Kaisho), as a financing institute for fudasashi (a trader who received or sold kuramai [storage rice] on behalf of the government for commission revenue).
sen.cmt: kuramai→kuramai [storage rice] 「（猿屋町貸金会所）｣：訳漏れ:(Saruya-cho Kashikin Kaisho)
sen.e: On the other hand, a special kaisho was established in Saruya-cho Town in Edo (Saruya-cho Kashikin Kaisho), as a financing institute for fudasashi (a trader who received or sold kuramai [storage rice] on behalf of the government for commission revenue).

sen.j: これは棄捐令によって打撃を受けた札差の経済的打撃を緩和するとともに、彼らを宥めて武家に対する貸し渋りを回避することを目的としていた。
sen.e: This was aimed to alleviate the economical blow of fudasai which had been caused by Kienrei (a relief measure to help gokenin [an immediate vassal of the shogunate] and hatamoto [a direct retainer of the Shogun] who fell into economic difficulties during the Edo period) along with talking into fudasashi to avoid credit crunches.

This was aimed to alleviate the economical blow that fudasashi received by Kienrei (a debt relief measure to help gokenin [an immediate vassal of the shogunate] and hatamoto [a direct retainer of the Shogun] who fell into economic difficulties during the Edo period) along with quieting the complaints of fudasashi to avoid their reluctance to provide fund to the samurai families.
sen.cmt: 「武家に対する」：訳漏れ: (to avoid their reluctance to provide fund) to the samurai families.武家に対する貸し渋りを回避する： to avoid credit crunches→to avoid their reluctance to provide fund to the samurai families
sen.e: This was aimed to alleviate the economical blow that fudasashi received by Kienrei (a debt relief measure to help gokenin [an immediate vassal of the shogunate] and hatamoto [a direct retainer of the Shogun] who fell into economic difficulties during the Edo period) along with quieting the complaints of fudasashi to avoid their reluctance to provide fund to the samurai families.

sen.j: なお、この町会所の実際の管理・運営は勘定所御用両替商があたっていた。
sen.e: Additionally, actual control and management of this machikaisho was carried out by the official exchange shops.
The control and management of this machi-gaisho was carried out by the official exchangers licensed by the finance ministry.
sen.cmt: Additionally, を取りました。勘定所御用両替商： the official exchangers licensed by the finance ministryとしました。「勘定所」：訳漏れ: (the official exchangers of) the finance ministry
sen.e: The control and management of this machi-gaisho was carried out by the official exchangers licensed by the finance ministry.

sen.j: 商人が組織した組合などの事務所を「会所」と呼んだ。
sen.e: An office for organizations of merchant guilds and so on was called 'kaisho.'
An office of a merchant guild or a similar association was called 'kaisho.'
sen.cmt: for organizations of merchant guilds and so on → a merchant guild or a similar association
sen.e: An office of a merchant guild or a similar association was called 'kaisho.'

sen.j: なお、下記の会所の中には役割が重複する部分が存在する事もあった。
sen.e: Incidentally, some roles of the following kaisho sometimes overlapped.
Incidentally, some of the kaisho mentioned below sometimes played overlapping roles.
Incidentally, some of the kaisho mentioned below sometimes played overlapping roles.

sen.j: 株仲間における事務所・集会所を会所と呼称し、役員や事務職員などが詰めて共有財産の管理や外部との交渉、所属商人との連絡や管理、重要決定を定める会合の招集、商品の品質検査など、株仲間や所属商人、取扱商品に関する管理などを行った。
sen.e: Offices or gathering places for kabunakama (merchant guild) was called kaisho, and management for kabunakama, merchant members and dealing commodities, including management of common properties, negotiations with outside parties, communication and management of merchant members, meeting summons for crucial decisions, quality check of commodities etc. were conducted by officers or clerical staff who worked there.

An office or a gathering place for kabunakama (a merchant guild) was called 'kaisho,' and the officers or clerical staff who were stationed there carried out management of the guild, its member merchants and dealing commodities, including the management of common properties, negotiations with outside parties, communication and management of its member merchants, organization of meetings for crucial decisions, quality check of commodities, etc.
sen.cmt: 構文、表現を変えました。
sen.e: An office or a gathering place for kabunakama (a merchant guild) was called 'kaisho,' and the officers or clerical staff who were stationed there carried out management of the guild, its member merchants and dealing commodities, including the management of common properties, negotiations with outside parties, communication and management of its member merchants, organization of meetings for crucial decisions, quality check of commodities, etc.

sen.j: 「寄合所」・「通路所」とも呼ばれている。
sen.e: The place was also called '寄合所' or '通路所.'
sen.cmt: 所が「しょ」か「じょ」か読み方不明です。
sen.e: It was also called 'yoriaijo(寄合所)' or 'tsurojo (通路所).'
sen.cmt: 正式な読み方が不明です。'yoriaijo(寄合所)' 'tsurojo (通路所).
sen.e: It was also called 'yoriaijo(寄合所)' or 'tsurojo (通路所).'

sen.j: 金銀貨の両替や米・綿・油などの商品の取引相場を定めて取引を行う、取引所・事務所としての役割を果たした。
sen.e: This place served functions as an exchange market and an office for trading, where market rates including gold and silver exchanges, commodities such as rice, cotton, oil, and so on were determined.

Kaisho served as an exchange market and a trading office, where the exchange market rate was determined for exchanging gold and silver currencies and the trading of such as commodities as rice, cotton and oil was undertaken.
sen.cmt: 構文、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Kaisho served as an exchange market and a trading office, where the exchange market rate was determined for exchanging gold and silver currencies and the trading of such as commodities as rice, cotton and oil was undertaken.

sen.j: 特に米の取引所としての会所の設置は全国各地で行われ、特に蔵屋敷が集中していた大坂堂島の米会所や長崎貿易による輸入品を扱った長崎市の長崎会所などは良く知られている。
sen.e: Establishment of kaisho, especially as a dealing place of rice, was spread out throughout the country; and kome-kaisho (rice kaisho) in Dojima of Osaka, where Kurayashiki-warehoses were especially concentrated, Nagasaki-kaisho in Nagasaki City where imported goods were treated and so on were well known.

Establishment of kaisho, in particular, as a dealing place of rice was spread out throughout the country; and among them Kome-kaisho (rice kaisho) in Dojima area of Osaka, where Kurayashiki (feudal lords' residence with adjoining warehouse) were especially concentrated, and Nagasaki-kaisho in Nagasaki City, where imported goods were treated, were well known.
sen.cmt: 構文、表現を若干変えました。
sen.e: Establishment of kaisho, in particular, as a dealing place of rice was spread out throughout the country; and among them Kome-kaisho (rice kaisho) in Dojima area of Osaka, where Kurayashiki (feudal lords' residence with adjoining warehouse) were especially concentrated, and Nagasaki-kaisho in Nagasaki City, where imported goods were treated, were well known.

sen.j: また、蔵屋敷直属の会所を「米立会所」・「払米捌所」とも呼称した。
sen.e: Additionally, kaisho under the direct control of kurayashiki-warehouse was called 'kome-tachiaisho' or 'haraimaihatsusho.'
Kaisho affiliated to a certain Kurayashiki was called 'kome-tachiaisho' (rice trading floor) or 'haraimai-sabakisho.' (released rice disposing floor).
sen.cmt: Additionally, を取りました。「米立会所」：'kome-tachiaisho' →kome-tachiaisho' (rice trading floor)「払米捌所」： 'haraimaihatsusho.'→'haraimai-sabakisho.' (released rice disposing floor) *正式な読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Kaisho affiliated to a certain Kurayashiki was called 'kome-tachiaisho' (rice trading floor) or 'haraimai-sabakisho.' (released rice disposing floor).

sen.j: 諸藩が専売品を生産管理・直接販売を行うために設置した役所。
sen.e: A public office where each domain established to conduct production management and direct marketing of monopoly goods.
An office set up by each domain to pursue its own production management and direct marketing of its monopoly goods.
sen.cmt: 表現、構文を変えました。
sen.e: An office set up by each domain to pursue its own production management and direct marketing of its monopoly goods.

sen.j: 藩が運営する事実上の商業組織であり、「産物会所」・「国産会所」と呼ばれ、あるいは産物名より「○○会所」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was an actual trading organization operated by a domain, and was also called 'sanbutsu-kaisho' (local products kaisho) or 'kokusan-kaisho' (local products kaisho), and occasionally it was called 'certain-kaisho' in which a specific name of product was used.

It was practically a domain-run commercial organization and called 'sanbutsu-kaisho' (local products kaisho) or 'kokusan-kaisho' (provincial products kaisho), and occasionally it was also called 'so-and-so kaisho' by a specific name of the product traded there.
sen.cmt: 表現をj若干変えました。産物名より「○○会所」：'so-and-so kaisho' by a specific name of the product traded there
sen.e: It was practically a domain-run commercial organization and called 'sanbutsu-kaisho' (local products kaisho) or 'kokusan-kaisho' (provincial products kaisho), and occasionally it was also called 'so-and-so kaisho' using a specific name of the product traded there.

sen.j: また、開国後には開港所に藩営の貿易機関として「藩会所」を設置して産品を輸出して武器や器械などを入手する藩もあった。
sen.e: Additionally, after opening of the country to the world, some domains established 'han-kaisho' (domain-kaisho) as a trading institution to obtain arms and other equipment at ports which were opened for foreign trading.

After Japan's opening up the country to the world, some domains established 'han-kaisho' (domain kaisho) as a trade institution at the ports opened for foreign trading, and obtained arms and other equipment by exporting their products.
sen.cmt: Additionally, を取り、表現を若干変えました。
sen.e: After Japan's opening up the country to the world, some domains established 'han-kaisho' (domain kaisho) as a trade institution at the ports opened for foreign trading, and obtained arms and other equipment by exporting their products.

sen.j: 江戸幕府はこうした諸藩の専売を物価高騰の原因として好意的には見ていなかった。
sen.e: Although the Edo bakufu didn't take a favorable view to domains' monopoly as the cause of steep price rise, bakufu itself promoted a concept of 'shoshoku-kaisho' (a kind of the Chamber of Commerce and Industry) in order to establish semi-nationalized distribution system of shoshoku (daily commodities) during the very last years of the Edo period (although the concept did not accomplished due to the collapse of the Edo bakufu).
sen.cmt: 「諸色会所」：意訳併記しました。
sen.e: Although the Edo bakufu didn't take a favorable view to domains' monopoly, considering it as the cause of steep price rise.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処表現を若干変えました。
sen.e: Although the Edo bakufu didn't take a favorable view to domains' monopoly, considering it as the cause of steep price rise.

sen.j: だが、最末期には幕府自らが諸色（生活物資）の流通機構を半国営化する「諸色会所」構想を推進した（もっとも、江戸幕府の滅亡によって実現しなかった）。
sen.e: However, the bakufu itself promoted a concept of 'shoshiki-kaisho' (daily commodity kaisho) in order to establish semi-nationalized distribution system of shoshiki (daily commodities) in the very last years of the Edo period (although the concept was never put into practice due to the collapse of the Edo bakufu).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処表現を若干変えました。
sen.e: However, the bakufu itself promoted a concept of 'shoshiki-kaisho' (daily commodity kaisho) in order to establish semi-nationalized distribution system of shoshiki (daily commodities) in the very last years of the Edo period (although the concept was never put into practice due to the collapse of the Edo bakufu).
